result.execSummary:
The defendant Andrew R. Schoepke was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Andrew R. Schoepke is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Andrew R. Schoepke was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Counseling as deemed appropriate by agent

Count 1 - Dismissed

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Andrew R. Schoepke
Current: 1609 Werner Allen, New London, WI 54961   (Effective: 07-11-2014)
Prior: 1609 Werered Allen, New London, WI 54961

Defendant Andrew R. Schoepke in court with attorney Stephen Michael Govin.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls @ 1:24 pm.  Plea advisement filed. State gives plea agreement, Complied with victim rights, ct 1 dismissed w/o prejudice plea to ct 2 withheld sentence 1 year probation, counseling, 100 fine plus costs, 3 days jail, completed. Parties agree to plea agreement, ct 2 D.C., domestic Guilty plea. Def. advised of constitutional rights & J.T. rights.  Atty Govin finds factual basis & is satisfied.  Court finds plea is freely & voluntarily given, accepts plea & finds def. Guilty to D.C., domestic in ct 2.  ct 1 dismissed consistent to plea agreement. Def. makes statement.  Court accepts plea agreement & orders withheld sentence 1 year probation, Counseling deemed by agent, 100 fine plus costs, 3 days jail, credit for 3 day served, completed. Bond applied. $200 DNA surcharge.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Def. advised of postconviction rights.

Defendant Andrew R. Schoepke in court with attorney Stephen M. Govin.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Def wishes to waive right to preliminary hearing.  Statement by Atty Govin.  Court explains right to preliminary hearing.   Def waives right to preliminary.  Court accept waiver.  Court finds probable cause.  Information filed.  Waive reading.  Not guilty plea entered.  Address checked.  Court will accept not guilty plea   Bond will continue  Status conference scheduled for June 2, 2014 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Andrew R. Schoepke not in court.  Ralph M Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court calls @ 2:17 pm.  State moves to lift no contact provision.  Court orders that no contact provision be lifted with A.M. Copy of minutes to Jail.
